revised_title: General Discussion on Enzymes, Fungi, and Agricultural Applications
tldr: This article discusses the potential uses of fungi and their enzymes in agriculture, focusing on the need for further research and development. The authors highlight the importance of studying the biochemical systematics of microfungi and their cellulolytic activities. They also mention the use of neem extracts in antifeedants, antiseptic dressings, and slow-release nitrogen fertilizers. The potential applications of microbial consortia in treating agricultural residues are also explored.
